thread.title: Swimmer critical after mauling by shark
thread.title_full: Swimmer critical after mauling by shark

title: Swimmer critical after mauling by shark
text:
The Hinchinbrook Channel in Hinchinbrook Island National Park. Kate Kyriacou The Courier-Mail Share on Twitter 
A SWIMMER attacked by a shark off Hinchinbrook Island is being flown to Townsville Hospital with critical leg injuries. 
A Queensland Ambulance Service spokesman said the man, believed to be aged in his 20s, had “very severe” injuries and had been attacked while swimming. 
Paramedics were called about 10.30am. Fear of Sharks Spurs Innovation in Australia 2:32 
Years of conservation efforts have bolstered shark populations in Australia, including that of the great white shark. This surf-loving nation is now developing new technologies to protect beachgoers from shark attacks. Photo: Brett Vercoe/NSW Government January 25th 2017 25 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/ 
It is understood the attack was witnessed by other swimmers and that the man had lost a significant amount of blood. 
The witnesses said they believed the shark was either a bull shark or a tiger shark. 
In 2015, a Melbourne woman disappeared after falling from a houseboat moored off Hinchinbrook Island. 
At the time, police said the waterway was “teeming” with dangerous wildlife, including various shark species and crocodiles.
